isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS - Circuit Function And Diagnostics - Two Speed Axle Speedometer Circuit

svcsubproc.title: Signal Functions

figure.caption: Function Diagram for Two Speed Axle

svcsubproc.para: The ECM is programmed with the high and low rear axle ratios. The ratios are used to calculate the speedometer signal, depending on which mode the switch is in. The ECM uses the high ratio unless voltage is applied to ECM pin 28 indicating the two speed selector switch is in the low range.
The two speed switch applies 12V to the ECM at pin 28 (and to the shift motor) when the switch is in the LO position.

svcsubproc.title: Diagnostic Trouble Code Detection / Management
svcsubproc.para: ECM diagnostics are not provided for two speed axle circuits.

figure.caption: Circuit Diagram for Two Speed Axle

para.emph: Use Electronic Service Tool for the following Test.

step1.para: Use the Electronic Service Tool (EST) to verify the correct ECM programming including correct rear axle ratios (high and low)

step2.para: If programmed correctly, go to step 2.
If the programming is not correct, make necessary programming corrections.

step1.para: Use the Electronic Service Tool (EST) diagnostic tool to monitor the two speed switch while changing switch position several times.

step2.para: If switch does not function, go to step 3.
If switch functions properly go to step 4.

step1.para:
Disconnect chassis connector from ECM. With key ON and switch in LOW position, measure voltage to ground at circuit 93A. Battery voltage (12V ± 1.5) should be present. See Two Speed Axle Circuit Diagram
.

step2.para: If less than 10.5V, check connections, if 0V, check for open/short to ground.
If battery voltage is present, replace the ECM.

step1.para: See Service Manual Group 08 Instruments, and perform Speedometer Self Diagnostic Test.

step2.para: If the self test is not OK, follow the recommendations of the service manual.

If the self test is OK, road test the vehicle and have a passenger monitor vehicle speed using the EST. If the EST displays the correct speed replace the speedometer/tachometer unit. If the EST does not display the correct speed, replace the ECM.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description

note.para: This section covers the two speed interface with the speedometer, not two speed axle operation.

svcsubproc.para: The vehicle speed sensor reads the revolutions of the transmission speedometer gear and sends a signal to the ECM. ECM programming includes the high and low rear axle ratios. The ECM uses the sensor input and rear axle ratios to calculate the speedometer signal, depending on which range the vehicle is operating in. When voltage is applied to ECM pin 28 from the two speed circuit, the ECM uses the low ratio.

The Two Speed Axle switch receives ACC power from 10A fuse F14. This is a normally open switch with High as the normal operating position. With the Two-Speed switch in the Low position, 12V accessory power is applied at ECM pin 28.
ECM diagnostics are not provided for this circuit.

step1.para: Before troubleshooting, make sure that the batteries are fully charged. Check battery connections and grounds for clean, tight connections free of damage. Voltage tests will give misleading results if the batteries are not fully charged.

Before troubleshooting, inspect circuit connectors for pushed back, loose, or damaged (spread or bent) terminals, or wires with cut strands etc. Wires and connections must be free of damage or corrosion. When some connectors corrode, a light white residue will be present that must be removed.
Before troubleshooting, inspect suspect circuit grounds for clean, tight connections free of damage.
